summary:
This mod adds two new dungeons and a cute little player home with all the modern amenities.
Larrys off to find some loot, but it seems his action have had consequences.
Do you want to go after him?
descriptionHtml:
Larry's Legacy

Someone's told Larry of a possible looting opportunity and he's left his little house in Riverwood to go and check it out.

Your journey begins at Larry's house just outside the Riverwood gate's where you'll find the first clue to his whereabouts and the key to henrik's tomb.
Larry's not at home so you can use it as your own. It's a nice cosy and function house with just about everything you'll need as a base of operations.

What's in this mod:

1 x Nordic Ruin (Henrik's Tomb) near Bleakfalls Barrow
1 x Mine / Dwemer ruin (Vengere Mine) west of Shor's Stone - north of Riften
1 x Player home (Larry's House) just outside Riverwood
1 x Secret Stash (hidden somewhere in skyrim - lookout for the clues)
2 x New Spell's (The Cold Snap / Direct Inquiry)
1 x New weapon (Larry's lucky sword)

This is my second instalment of Larry's little adventure and contain's some of the same cells (Henriks Tomb) as the first, so if you have my previous mod I would suggest removing it and creating a clean save before using this one....it's worth it...this is much better!!

Look closely as there are diaries and note's scattered around the place and on npc's to guide you.
During testing this took me about an hour and thirty minutes of game-play to complete, not including the search for the secret stash.

This file has been cleaned with TES5Edit and all attempt's have been made to make as little impact as possible, but if i've missed something please let me know in the comments. i've used only Vanilla texture's and items so no other file's are needed.

I'm planning a third and final part to this series which i'll hopefully have done soon called Featherbrook Castle where we'll have a showdown with "THE BOSS".

This is only my second dungeon mod release so any advice or comments good or bad are welcome..

Thank's.
author: GreenSmirf
